head.supplied: The Comr of Crown Lands ¶ ¶ Baron von Mueller asks in a letter ¶ Letter not found. ¶ ¶ whether Mr Lewis did collect any plants on his explorations near Lake Eyre and also, if the same will be forwar...

div.p: No. 799, 1875, Crown Lands and Immigration Office, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

To proof.
The Comr of Crown Lands

Baron von Mueller asks in a letter
Letter not found.
whether Mr Lewis did collect any plants on his explorations near Lake Eyre and also, if the same will be forwarded to him for description as has been done formerly with plants collected by other explorers.
On 29 June 1875,JamesBoucaut, C.C.L. [Chief Commissioner of Lands], minuted: 'I shall be glad to know from the Surveyor General what has been the usual case in respect to this matter which has been brought before me by Mr Krichauff M.P.' This was forwarded to G. Goyder, Surveyor General, the next day who replied immediately that specimens were usually forwarded to the SA Government Botanist, R. Schomburgk, 'who will probably forward Duplicates to Baron von Mueller if requested or instructed to do so by the Govt'. This information was sent to Krichauff. In a minute dated 7/6, in error for July, Schomburgk wrote: 'Very few specimens have been collected by Mr Lewis, of which duplicates will be forwarded to the Government Botanist Melbourne'.
